definition: to impart boldness or courage to : to instill with boldness, courage, or resolution enough to overcome timidity or misgiving
examples: Great leaders embolden the rest of us to rise to our highest potentialities, to be active, insistent and resolute in affirming our own sense of things.
… being near her twin did seem to embolden her, to loosen her tongue.
… other voices too timid to speak in class are often emboldened by the different and more protected role an on-line conversation provides.
